quote:
(2) Nothing is always.
(3) Everything is sometimes.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote:
A beginning is the time for taking the most delicate care that balances are
correct.
author: Princess Irulan, \Manual of Maud'Dib\""

quote: A bird in the bush usually has a friend in there with him.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: A bird in the hand is worth two in the bush.
author: Cervantes

quote: A bird in the hand is worth what it will bring.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: A bird in the hand makes it awfully hard to blow your nose.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote:
A boy spent years collecting postage stamps.  The girl next door bought
an album too, and started her own collection.  \Dad, she buys everything I've
bought, and it's taken all the fun out of it for me.  I'm quitting.\"  Don't,
son, remember, 'Imitation is the sincerest form of philately.'\""
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote:
A certain amount of opposition is a help, not a hindrance. Kites rise
against the wind, not with it.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: A chicken is an egg's way of producing more eggs.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: A chronic disposition to inquiry deprives domestic felines of vital qualities.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: A clever prophet makes sure of the event first.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: A closed mouth gathers no foot.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: A couch is as good as a chair.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: A day without orange juice is like a day without orange juice.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: A day without sunshine is like a day without Anita Bryant.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: A day without sunshine is like a day without orange juice.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: A day without sunshine is like night.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: A dead man cannot bite.
author: Gnaeus Pompeius (Pompey)

quote: A farmer is a man outstanding in his field.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: A farmer with extremely prolific hens posted the following sign.  \Free
Chickens.  Our Coop Runneth Over.\""
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote:
A father gave his teen-age daughter an untrained pedigreed pup for
her birthday.  An hour later, when wandering through the house, he found her
looking at a puddle in the center of the kitchen.  \My pup,\" she murmured
sadly, \"runneth over.\""
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: A fool and his money are soon popular.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: A fool and your money are soon partners.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: A fool must now and then be right by chance.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: A foolish consistency is the hobgoblin of little minds.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: A friend in need is a pest indeed.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: A full belly makes a dull brain.
author:
Ben Franklin

		[and the local candy machine man.  Ed]

quote:
A girl spent a couple hours on the phone talking to her two best
friends, Maureen Jones, and Maureen Brown.  When asked by her father why she
had been on the phone so long, she responded \I heard a funny story today
and I've been telling it to the Maureens.\""
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: A gleekzorp without a tornpee is like a quop without a fertsneet (sort of).
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: A good memory does not equal pale ink.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote:
A good name lost is seldom regained.  When character is gone,
all is gone, and one of the richest jewels of life is lost forever.
author: J. Hawes

quote: A good plan today is better than a perfect plan tomorrow.
author: Patton

quote: A good reputation is more valuable than money.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote:
A good scapegoat is hard to find.
A guilty conscience is the mother of invention.
author: Carolyn Wells

quote: A handful of friends is worth more than a wagon of gold.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: A handful of patience is worth more than a bushel of brains.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: A hermit is a deserter from the army of humanity.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: A homeowner's reach should exceed his grasp, or what's a weekend for?
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote:
A horse breeder has his young colts bottle-fed after they're three
days old.  He heard that a foal and his mummy are soon parted.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: A hundred thousand lemmings can't be wrong!
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: A journey of a thousand miles begins with a cash advance.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: A journey of a thousand miles must begin with a single step.
author: Lao Tsu

quote: A journey of a thousand miles starts under one's feet.
author: Lao Tsu

quote: A king's castle is his home.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: A lie in time saves nine.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote:
A lie is an abomination unto the Lord and a very present help in time of
trouble.
author: Adlai Stevenson

quote: A likely impossibility is always preferable to an unconvincing possibility.
author: Aristotle

quote: A little experience often upsets a lot of theory.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: A little inaccuracy saves a world of explanation.
author: C. E. Ayres

quote: A little inaccuracy sometimes saves tons of explanation.
author: H. H. Munro, \Saki\""

quote: A lost ounce of gold may be found, a lost moment of time never.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote:
A man gazing at the stars is proverbially at the mercy of the puddles
in the road.
author: Alexander Smith

quote:
A man who carries a cat by its tail learns something he can learn
in no other way.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote:
A man with one watch knows what time it is.
A man with two watches is never quite sure.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: A man's best friend is his dogma.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: A man's house is his castle.
author: Sir Edward Coke

quote: A man's house is his hassle.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: A mind is a wonderful thing to waste.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: A mushroom cloud has no silver lining.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: A penny saved has not been spent.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: A penny saved is ridiculous.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote:
A pipe gives a wise man time to think and a fool something to stick in his
mouth.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: A place for everything and everything in its place.
author: Isabella Mary Beeton, \The Book of Household Management\"

quote: [Quoted in \"VMS Internals and Data Structures\", V4.4, when
referring to memory management system services.]"
author: NA

quote: A platitude is simply a truth repeated till people get tired of hearing it.
author: Stanley Baldwin

quote:
A plethora of individuals with expertise in culinary techniques contaminate
the potable concoction produced by steeping certain edible nutriments.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: A plucked goose doesn't lay golden eggs.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: A pound of salt will not sweeten a single cup of tea.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: \A radioactive cat has eighteen half-lives.\""
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: A rolling stone gathers momentum.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: A rolling stone gathers no moss.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: A shortcut is the longest distance between two points.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: A sinking ship gathers no moss.
author: Donald Kaul

quote: A Smith & Wesson beats four aces.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: A snake lurks in the grass.
author: Publius Vergilius Maro (Virgil)

quote: A soft answer turneth away wrath; but grievous words stir up anger.
author: Proverbs 15:1

quote: A soft drink turneth away company.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: A song in time is worth a dime.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: A stitch in time saves nine.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: A violent man will die a violent death.
author: Lao Tsu

quote: A watched clock never boils.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote:
A wise man can see more from a mountain top than a fool can from the bottom
of a well.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote:
A wise man can see more from the bottom of a well than a fool can from a
mountain top.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: A wise person makes his own decisions, a weak one obeys public opinion.
author: Chinese proverb

quote:
A witty saying proves nothing, but saying something pointless gets
people's attention.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: A witty saying proves nothing.
author: Voltaire

quote: A word to the wise is enough.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: Above all else -- sky.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Above all things, reverence yourself.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Absence makes the heart forget.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Absence makes the heart go wander.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Absence makes the heart grow fonder -- of somebody else.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Absence makes the heart grow fonder.
author: Sextus Aurelius

quote: Absence makes the heart grow frantic.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Absolutum obsoletum.  (If it works, it's out of date.)
author: Stafford Beer

quote:
Ad astra per aspera.
	[To the stars by aspiration.]
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote:
Adde parvum parvo manus acervus erit.
	[Add little to little and there will be a big pile.]
author: Ovid

quote: Advice from an old carpenter: measure twice, saw once.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: After the game the king and the pawn go in the same box.
author: Italian proverb

quote: Age and treachery will always overcome youth and skill.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Age before beauty; and pearls before swine.
author: Dorothy Parker

quote: Aim for the moon.  If you miss, you may hit a star.
author: W. Clement Stone

quote: Ain't no right way to do a wrong thing.
author: The Mad Dogtender

quote: Alas, I am dying beyond my means.
author: Oscar Wilde [as he sipped champagne on his deathbed]

quote: Alimony is the high cost of leaving.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: All a man needs out of life is a place to sit 'n' spit in the fire.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: All articles that coruscate with resplendence are not truly auriferous.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote:
-- All articles that coruscate with resplendence are not truly auriferous.
-- When there are visible vapors having the prevenience in ignited
	carbonaceous materials, there is conflagration.
-- Sorting on the part of mendicants must be interdicted.
-- A plethora of individuals wither expertise in culinary techniques vitiated
	the potable concoction produced by steeping certain coupestibles.
-- Eleemosynary deeds have their initial incidence intramurally.
-- Male cadavers are incapable of yielding testimony.
-- Individuals who make their abode in vitreous edifices would be well
	advised to refrain from catapulting projectiles.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote:
All I kin say is when you finds yo'self wanderin' in a peach orchard,
ya don't go lookin' for rutabagas.
author: Kingfish

quote: All is fear in love and war.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: All is well that ends well.
author: John Heywood

quote: All that glitters has a high refractive index.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: All that glitters is not gold; all that wander are not lost.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: All things are possible, except for skiing through a revolving door.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: All things being equal, you are bound to lose.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: All true wisdom is found on T-shirts.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: All's well that ends.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote:
An aphorism is never exactly true; it is either a half-truth or
one-and-a-half truths.
author: Karl Kraus

quote: An apple a day makes 365 apples a year.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: An apple every eight hours will keep three doctors away.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: An idle mind is worth two in the bush.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: An ounce of clear truth is worth a pound of obfuscation.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: An ounce of hypocrisy is worth a pound of ambition.
author: Michael Korda

quote: An ounce of mother is worth a ton of priest.
author: Spanish proverb

quote: \An ounce of prevention is worth a pound of purge.\""
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: And tomorrow will be like today, only more so.
author: Isaiah 56:12, New Standard Version

quote: Answer a fool according to his folly, lest he be wise in his own conceit.
author: Proverbs, 26:5

quote:
Any great truth can -- and eventually will -- be expressed as a cliche --
a cliche is a sure and certain way to dilute an idea.  For instance, my
grandmother used to say, \The black cat is always the last one off the fence.\"
I have no idea what she meant, but at one time, it was undoubtedly true."
author: Solomon Short

quote: Any philosophy that can be put \in a nutshell\" belongs there."
author: Sydney J. Harris

quote:
Any road followed to its end leads precisely nowhere.
Climb the mountain just a little to test it's a mountain.
From the top of the mountain, you cannot see the mountain.
author: Bene Gesserit proverb, \Dune\""

quote: Anything is possible on paper.
author: Ron McAfee

quote: Anything is possible, unless it's not.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote:
Anything that is worth doing has been done frequently.  Things hitherto
undone should be given, I suspect, a wide berth.
author: Max Beerbohm, \Mainly on the Air\""

quote: Anything worth doing is worth overdoing.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: As well look for a needle in a bottle of hay.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote:
Ask not for whom the Bell tolls, and you will pay only the station-to-station
rate.
author: Howard Kandel

quote:
Ask not for whom the telephone bell tolls...
if thou art in the bathtub, it tolls for thee.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Avoid cliches like the plague.  They're a dime a dozen.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Be both a speaker of words and a doer of deeds.
author: Homer

quote: Be sure to evaluate the bird-hand/bush ratio.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Beggars should be no choosers.
author: John Heywood

quote: Better dead than mellow.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Better hope you get what you want before you stop wanting it.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Better late than never.
author: Titus Livius (Livy)

quote: Better living a beggar than buried an emperor.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Better to be nouveau than never to have been riche at all.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Better to light one candle than to curse the darkness.
author: motto of the Christopher Society

quote: Better tried by twelve than carried by six.
author: Jeff Cooper

quote: Beware of friends who are false and deceitful.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Beware of geeks bearing graft.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Call on God, but row away from the rocks.
author: Indian proverb

quote: Charity begins at home.
author: Publius Terentius Afer (Terence)

quote: Cheap things are of no value, valuable things are not cheap.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Cleanliness becomes more important when godliness is unlikely.
author: P. J. O'Rourke

quote: Cleanliness is next to impossible.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote:
Cogito cogito ergo cogito sum --
\I think that I think, therefore I think that I am.\""
author: Ambrose Bierce, \The Devil's Dictionary\""

quote: \Cogito ergo I'm right and you're wrong.\""
author: Blair Houghton

quote: Curiosity killed the cat, but satisfaction brought her back.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Desist from enumerating your fowl prior to their emergence from the shell.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Do not count your chickens before they are hatched.
author: Aesop

quote: Do unto others before they undo you.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Do, or do not; there is no try.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Doing gets it done.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Don't get even -- get odd!
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Don't get mad, get even.
author:
Joseph P. Kennedy

Don't get even, get jewelry.

quote: Don't get mad, get interest.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote:
Don't put off for tomorrow what you can do today because if you enjoy it today,
you can do it again tomorrow.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Eschew obfuscation.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Every path has its puddle.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Every silver lining has a cloud around it.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Every solution breeds new problems.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Expedience is the best teacher.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Experience is a good teacher, but she sends in terrific bills.
author: Minna Antrim, \Naked Truth and Veiled Allusions\""

quote: Familiarity breeds attempt.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Flattery will get you everywhere.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Flee at once, all is discovered.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: For fools rush in where angels fear to tread.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Forgive and forget.
author: Cervantes

quote: Fortune and love befriend the bold.
author: Ovid

quote: Fortune favors the lucky.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote:
Fortune finishes the great quotations, #12

	Those who can, do.  Those who can't, write the instructions.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote:
Fortune finishes the great quotations, #3

	Birds of a feather flock to a newly washed car.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote:
Fortune finishes the great quotations, #9

	A word to the wise is often enough to start an argument.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Freedom from incrustation of grime is contiguous to rectitude.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Genius is pain.
author: John Lennon

quote: Given sufficient time, what you put off doing today will get done by itself.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote:
God gave man two ears and one tongue so that we listen twice as much as
we speak.
author: Arab proverb

quote: Happiness adds and multiplies as we divide it with others.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Happiness is the greatest good.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Haste makes waste.
author: John Heywood

quote: Have a nice day!
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Have a nice diurnal anomaly.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Have an adequate day.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: He that bringeth a present, findeth the door open.
author: Scottish proverb.

quote: He who fears the unknown may one day flee from his own backside.
author: Sinbad

quote: He who fights and runs away lives to fight another day.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: He who foresees calamities suffers them twice over.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: He who has a shady past knows that nice guys finish last.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: He who has imagination without learning has wings but no feet.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote:
He who has the courage to laugh is almost as much a master of the world
as he who is ready to die.
author: Giacomo Leopardi

quote: He who hates vices hates mankind.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: He who hesitates is last.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: He who hesitates is sometimes saved.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: He who laughs has not yet heard the bad news.
author: Bertolt Brecht

quote: He who laughs last -- missed the punch line.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: He who laughs last didn't get the joke.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: He who laughs last hasn't been told the terrible truth.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: He who laughs last is probably your boss.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: He who laughs last usually had to have joke explained.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: He who laughs, lasts.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: He who lives without folly is less wise than he believes.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: He who makes a beast of himself gets rid of the pain of being a man.
author: Dr. Johnson

quote: Honesty is the best policy, but insanity is a better defense.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Honesty's the best policy.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote:
Honi soit qui mal y pense.
	[Evil to him who evil thinks.]
author: Motto of the Order of the Garter (est. Edward III)

quote: How sharper than a hound's tooth it is to have a thankless serpent.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: How you look depends on where you go.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: I am a man: nothing human is alien to me.
author: Publius Terentius Afer (Terence)

quote: I doubt, therefore I might be.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: I know on which side my bread is buttered.
author: John Heywood

quote: I think, therefore I am... I think.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: I'll turn over a new leaf.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: If a fool persists in his folly he shall become wise.
author: William Blake

quote: If anything can go wrong, it will.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: If at first you do succeed, try to hide your astonishment.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: If at first you don't succeed, destroy all evidence that you tried.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: If at first you don't succeed, quit; don't be a nut about success.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: If at first you don't succeed, redefine success.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: If at first you don't succeed, try, try again.
author: W. E. Hickson

quote: If at first you don't succeed, you're doing about average.
author: Leonard Levinson

quote: If happiness is in your destiny, you need not be in a hurry.
author: Chinese proverb

quote: If I cannot bend Heaven, I shall move Hell.
author: Publius Vergilius Maro (Virgil)

quote: If in doubt, mumble.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: If it ain't broke, don't fix it.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: If it heals good, say it.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: If the shoe fits, it's ugly.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: If the thunder don't get you, then the lightning will.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: If there is no wind, row.
author: Polish proverb

quote: If two wrongs don't make a right, try three.
author: Laurence J. Peter

quote: If wishes were horses, then beggars would be thieves.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote:
If you wish to be happy for one hour, get drunk.
If you wish to be happy for three days, get married.
If you wish to be happy for a month, kill your pig and eat it.
If you wish to be happy forever, learn to fish.
author: Chinese Proverb

quote: If you wish to succeed, consult three old people.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: If you would keep a secret from an enemy, tell it not to a friend.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: In charity there is no excess.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: In God we trust; all else we walk through.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: In this world, nothing is certain but death and taxes.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Inspiration without perspiration is usually sterile.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Integrity has no need for rules.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: It doesn't matter whether you win or lose -- until you lose.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: It is a poor judge who cannot award a prize.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: It is a profitable thing, if one is wise, to seem foolish.
author: Aeschylus

quote: It is annoying to be honest to no purpose.
author: Publius Ovidius Naso (Ovid)

quote: It is bad luck to be superstitious.
author: Andrew W. Mathis

quote: It is better to have loved a short man than never to have loved a tall.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: It is better to have loved and lost -- much better.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: It is better to have loved and lost than just to have lost.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: It is better to wear out than to rust out.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote:
It is common sense to take a method and try it.  If it fails,
admit it frankly and try another.  But above all, try something.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: It is sweet to let the mind unbend on occasion.
author: Quintus Horatius Flaccus (Horace)

quote: It is the quality rather than the quantity that matters.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: It is when I struggle to be brief that I become obscure.
author: Quintus Horatius Flaccus (Horace)

quote: It is wise to keep in mind that neither success nor failure is ever final.
author: Roger Babson

quote: It is your concern when your neighbor's wall is on fire.
author: Quintus Horatius Flaccus (Horace)

quote: It's always darkest just before it gets pitch black.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: It's always darkest just before the lights go out.
author: Alex Clark

quote: It's better to burn out than it is to rust.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: It's better to burn out than to fade away.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: It's later than you think.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: It's not whether you win or lose, it's how you place the blame.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: It's the thought, if any, that counts!
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Keep on keepin' on.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Keep the phase, baby.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Kites rise highest against the wind -- not with it.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Knowledge is power.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Knowledge without common sense is folly.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Laugh and the world laughs with you, snore and you sleep alone.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Laugh and the world thinks you're an idiot.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Laugh at your problems; everybody else does.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Laugh when you can; cry when you must.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Laugh, and the world ignores you.  Crying doesn't help either.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Leave no stone unturned.
author: Euripides

quote: Left to themselves, things tend to go from bad to worse.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Let sleeping dogs lie.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: Let your conscience be your guide.
author: Pope

quote: Life is one long struggle in the dark.
author: Titus Lucretius Carus

quote: \Life is too important to take seriously.\""
author: Corky Siegel

quote: Life is too short to be taken seriously.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Look before you leap.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: Look ere ye leap.
author: John Heywood

quote:
-- Male cadavers are incapable of yielding testimony.
-- Individuals who make their abode in vitreous edifices would be well advised
	to refrain from catapulting projectiles.
-- Neophyte's serendipity.
-- Exclusive dedication to necessitious chores without interludes of hedonistic
	diversion renders John a hebetudinous fellow.
-- A revolving concretion of earthy or mineral matter accumulates no congeries
	of small, green bryophytic plant.
-- Abstention from any aleatory undertaking precludes a potential escallation
	of a lucrative nature.
-- Missiles of ligneous or osteal consistency have the potential of fracturing
	osseous structure, but appellations will eternally remain innocuous.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Man is the measure of all things.
author: Protagoras

quote: Mankind is poised midway between the gods and the beasts.
author: Plotinus

quote: Many are called, few are chosen.  Fewer still get to do the choosing.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Many are called, few volunteer.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Many are cold, but few are frozen.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Many hands make light work.
author: John Heywood

quote:
May you have warm words on a cold evening,
a full mooon on a dark night,
and a smooth road all the way to your door.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: May you live in interesting times.
author: Chinese proverb

quote: Men freely believe that what they wish to desire.
author: Julius Caesar

quote: Misery loves company, but company does not reciprocate.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Misery no longer loves company.  Nowadays it insists on it.
author: Russell Baker

quote: Misfortunes arrive on wings and leave on foot.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Mistakes are often the stepping stones to utter failure.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Mistrust first impulses; they are always right.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Moderation in all things.
author: Publius Terentius Afer [Terence]

quote: Moderation is a fatal thing.  Nothing succeeds like excess.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Mother is the invention of necessity.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Mum's the word.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: Necessity has no law.
author: St. Augustine

quote: Necessity hath no law.
author: Oliver Cromwell

quote: Necessity is a mother.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote:
-- Neophyte's serendipity.
-- Exclusive dedication to necessitious chores without interludes of
	hedonistic diversion renders John a hebetudinous fellow.
-- A revolving concretion of earthy or mineral matter accumulates no
	congeries of small, green bryophytic plant.
-- The person presenting the ultimate cachinnation possesses thereby the
	optimal cachinnation.
-- Abstention from any aleatory undertaking precludes a potential
	escallation of a lucrative nature.
-- Missiles of ligneous or osteal consistency have the potential of
	fracturing osseous structure, but appellations will eternally
	remain innocuous.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Never do today what you can put off until tomorrow.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Never look a gift horse in the mouth.
author: Saint Jerome

quote: Never promise more than you can perform.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: Never put off till tomorrow what you can avoid all together.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Never put off until tomorrow what you can do the day after.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Nice guys don't finish nice.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Nice guys finish last, but we get to sleep in.

quote: Nice guys finish last.
author: Leo Durocher

quote: Nice guys get sick.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: No act of kindness, no matter how small, is ever wasted.
author: Aesop

quote: No evil can happen to a good man.
author: Plato

quote: No excellent soul is exempt from a mixture of madness.
author: Aristotle

quote: No good deed goes unpunished.
author: Clare Booth Luce

quote: None love the bearer of bad news.
author: Sophocles

quote: Not everything worth doing is worth doing well.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Nothing endures but change.
author: Heraclitus

quote:
Nothing ever becomes real till it is experienced -- even a
proverb is no proverb to you till your life has illustrated it.
author: John Keats

quote:
Nullum magnum ingenium sine mixtura dementiae fuit.
	[There is no great genius without some touch of madness.]
author: Seneca

quote: Often things ARE as bad as they seem!
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Once a word has been allowed to escape, it cannot be recalled.
author: Quintus Horatius Flaccus (Horace)

quote: Once harm has been done, even a fool understands it.
author: Homer

quote: One good turn asketh another.
author: John Heywood

quote: One good turn deserves another.
author: Gaius Petronius

quote: One good turn usually gets most of the blanket.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: One man's Mede is another man's Persian.
author: George M. Cohan

quote: One picture is worth more than ten thousand words.
author: Chinese proverb

quote: Oppernockity tunes but once.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Out of sight is out of mind.
author: Arthur Clough

quote: -- Owen Meredith
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Patience is the best remedy for every trouble.
author: Titus Maccius Plautus

quote:
Pauca sed matura.
	[Few but excellent.]
author: Gauss

quote:
Pereant, inquit, qui ante nos nostra dixerunt.
	[Confound those who have said our remarks before us.]
	or
	[May they perish who have expressed our bright ideas before us.]
author: Aelius Donatus

quote: Pity the meek, for they shall inherit the earth.
author: Don Marquis

quote:
Plus ,ca change, plus c'est la m^eme chose.
	[The more things change, the more they remain the same.]
author: Alphonse Karr, \Les Gu^epes\""

quote: Practice yourself what you preach.
author: Titus Maccius Plautus

quote: Praise the sea; on shore remain.
author: John Florio

quote: Pray to God, but keep rowing to shore.
author: Russian Proverb

quote: Prosperity makes friends, adversity tries them.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote:
Quidquid latine dictum sit, altum videtur.
	[Whatever is said in Latin sounds profound.]
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Remembering is for those who have forgotten.
author: Chinese proverb

quote:
Removing the straw that broke the camel's back does not necessarily

author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Rome was not built in one day.
author: John Heywood

quote: Rome wasn't burnt in a day.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Rotten wood cannot be carved.
author: Confucius, \Analects\", Book 5, Ch. 9"

quote:
-- Scintillate, scintillate, asteroid minikin.
-- Members of an avian species of identical plumage congregate.
-- Surveillance should precede saltation.
-- Pulchritude possesses solely cutaneous profundity.
-- It is fruitless to become lachrymose over precipitately departed
	lacteal fluid.
-- Freedom from incrustations of grime is contiguous to rectitude.
-- It is fruitless to attempt to indoctrinate a superannuated
	canine with innovative maneuvers.
-- Eschew the implement of correction and vitiate the scion.
-- The temperature of the aqueous content of an unremittingly
	galled saucepan does not reach 212 degrees Farenheit.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Scintillation is not always identification for an auric substance.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Seek simplicity -- and distrust it.
author: Alfred North Whitehead

quote: Seize the day, put no trust in the morrow!
author: Quintus Horatius Flaccus (Horace)

quote: Set the cart before the horse.
author: John Heywood

quote:
Si jeunesse savait, si vieillesse pouvait.
	[If youth but knew, if old age but could.]
author: Henri Estienne

quote: Sic transit gloria Monday!
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote:
Sic transit gloria mundi.
	[So passes away the glory of this world.]
author: Thomas `a Kempis

quote: Sic Transit Gloria Thursdi.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Small change can often be found under seat cushions.
author: One of Lazarus Long's most penetrating insights

quote: Small is beautiful.
author: Schumacher's Dictum

quote: Stop searching forever.  Happiness is just next to you.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Stop searching forever.  Happiness is unattainable.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote:
Stop searching.  Happiness is right next to you.  Now, if they'd only
take a bath ...
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Sweet April showers do spring May flowers.
author: Thomas Tusser

quote: The coast was clear.
author: Lope de Vega

quote: The course of true anything never does run smooth.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: The descent to Hades is the same from every place.
author: Anaxagoras

quote: The early worm gets the bird.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: The early worm gets the late bird.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: The ends justify the means.
author: after Matthew Prior

quote: The greatest love is a mother's, then a dog's, then a sweetheart's.
author: Polish proverb

quote: The life which is unexamined is not worth living.
author: Plato

quote: The light at the end of the tunnel is the headlight of an approaching train.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: The light at the end of the tunnel may be an oncoming dragon.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: The man who runs may fight again.
author: Menander

quote:
The man who sees, on New Year's day, Mount Fuji, a hawk, and an eggplant
is forever blessed.
author: Old Japanese proverb

quote: The meek will inherit the earth -- if that's OK with you.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: The more the merrier.
author: John Heywood

quote: The more things change, the more they stay insane.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: The more things change, the more they'll never be the same again.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: The only certainty is that nothing is certain.
author: Pliny the Elder

quote: The only constant is change.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: The only problem with seeing too much is that it makes you insane.
author: Phaedrus

quote: The only reward of virtue is virtue.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: \The porcupine with the sharpest quills gets stuck on a tree more often.\""
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: The proof of the pudding is in the eating.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: The reverse side also has a reverse side.
author: Japanese proverb

quote: The road to Hades is easy to travel.
author: Bion

quote: The superfluous is very necessary.
author: Voltaire

quote:
The temperature of the aqueous content of an unremittingly ogled
culinary vessel will not achieve 100 degrees on the Celsius scale.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: The worst is enemy of the bad.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote:
-- The writing implement is more potent than the claymore.
-- All articles that coruscate with resplendence are not truly auriferous.
-- When there are visible vapors having the prevenience in ignited carbonaceous
	materials, there is conflagration.
-- Sorting on the part of mendicants must be interdicted.
-- A plethora of individuals wither expertise in culinary techniques vitiated
	the potable concoction produced by steeping certain coupestibles.
-- The person presenting the ultimate cachinnation possesses thereby the
	optimal cachinnation.
author: Eleemosynary deeds have their initial incidence intramurally.

quote: There are more things in heaven and earth than any place else.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: There are more ways of killing a cat than choking her with cream.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: There is no fool to the old fool.
author: John Heywood

quote: There is no grief which time does not lessen and soften.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: There is no proverb that is not true.
author: Cervantes

quote: There's an old proverb that says just about whatever you want it to.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: There's no heavier burden than a great potential.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: There's no such thing as a free lunch.
author: Milton Friendman

quote: There's no such thing as an original sin.
author: Elvis Costello

quote: There's no time like the pleasant.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Things are more like they are today than they ever were before.
author: Dwight Eisenhower

quote: Things are more like they used to be than they are now.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Things are not always what they seem.
author: Phaedrus

quote: Things fall apart; the centre cannot hold.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Thou hast seen nothing yet.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: Three may keep a secret, if two of them are dead.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Time and tide wait for no man.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Time as he grows old teaches all things.
author: Aeschylus

quote: Time flies like an arrow.  Fruit flies like a banana.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote:
Time goes, you say?
Ah no!
Time stays, *we* go.
author: Austin Dobson

quote: Time sure flies when you don't know what you're doing.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: To add insult to injury.
author: Phaedrus

quote: To err is human, but I can REALLY foul things up.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote:
To err is human, but when the eraser wears out before the pencil,
you're overdoing it a little.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: To err is human, to forgive is against company policy.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: To err is human, to forgive unusual.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: To err is human, to moo bovine.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote:
To err is human, to purr feline.
To err is human, two curs canine.
To err is human, to moo bovine.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: To err is human, to repent, divine, to persist, devilish.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote:
To err is human.
To blame someone else for your mistakes is even more human.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: To err is human; to admit it, a blunder.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: To err is human; to forgive is simply not our policy.
author: MIT Assasination Club

quote: To err is humor.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: To every Ph.D. there is an equal and opposite Ph.D.
author: B. Duggan

quote: Treat your friend as if he might become an enemy.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: Trust in Allah, but tie your camel.
author: Arabian proverb

quote: Truth can wait; he's used to it.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Turn the other cheek.
author: Jesus Christ

quote: Two heads are better than one.
author: John Heywood

quote: Two heads are more numerous than one.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Two is company, three is an orgy.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Two wrongs are only the beginning.
author: Kohn

quote: Two wrongs don't make a right, but they make a good excuse.
author: Thomas Szasz

quote: Two wrongs don't make a right, but three lefts do.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Walking on water wasn't built in a day.
author: Jack Kerouac

quote: We are what we are.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: We are what we pretend to be.
author: Kurt Vonnegut, Jr.

quote: We have seen the light at the end of the tunnel, and it's out.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Well begun is half done.
author: Aristotle

quote: What fools these morals be!
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: What fools these mortals be.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: What one believes to be true either is true or becomes true.
author: John Lilly

quote: What one fool can do, another can.
author: Ancient Simian Proverb

quote: What we wish, that we readily believe.
author: Demosthenes

quote: What you don't know can hurt you, only you won't know it.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: What you don't know won't help you much either.
author: D. Bennett

quote: Whatever it is, I fear Greeks even when they bring gifts.
author: Publius Vergilius Maro (Virgil)

quote: When in doubt, follow your heart.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: When in doubt, use brute force.
author: Ken Thompson

quote: When nothing can possibly go wrong, it will.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: When the ax entered the forest, the trees said, \The handle is one of us!\""
author: Turkish proverb

quote: When the blind lead the blind they will both fall over the cliff.
author: Chinese proverb

quote: When the going gets tough, everyone leaves.
author: Lynch

quote: When the going gets tough, the tough go shopping.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: When the going gets weird, the weird turn pro.
author: Hunter S. Thompson

quote:
When the only tool you have is a hammer, every problem starts to look
like a nail.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: When the sun shineth, make hay.
author: John Heywood

quote: When we talk of tomorrow, the gods laugh.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote:
When you are at Rome live in the Roman style; when you are elsewhere live
as they live elsewhere.
author: St. Ambrose

quote: When you are in it up to your ears, keep your mouth shut.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote:
When you have eliminated the impossible, whatever remains, however improbable,
must be the truth.
author: Sherlock Holmes, \The Sign of Four\""

quote:
Where there are visible vapors, having their prevenance in ignited
carbonaceous materials, there is conflagration.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Where there is much light there is also much shadow.
author: Goethe

quote: While there's life, there's hope.
author: Publius Terentius Afer (Terence)

quote: Whom the gods wish to destroy they first call promising.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Whom the mad would destroy, first they make Gods.
author: Bernard Levin

quote: Without fools there would be no wisdom.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Words are the voice of the heart.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Words can never express what words can never express.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: Words have a longer life than deeds.
author: Pindar

quote: Would ye both eat your cake and have your cake?
author: John Heywood

quote: You buttered your bread, now lie in it.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: You can drive a horse to water, but a pencil must be lead.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote:
You can fool some of the people all of the time,
and all of the people some of the time,
but you can make a fool of yourself anytime.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote:
You can fool some of the people all of the time,
and all of the people some of the time,
but you can never fool your Mom.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote:
You can fool some of the people some of the time,
and some of the people all of the time,
and that is sufficient.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote:
You can get everything in life you want, if you will help enough other
people get what they want.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote:
You can get much further with a kind word and a gun than you can with a
kind word alone.
author:
Al Capone
		[Also attributed to Johnny Carson.  Ed.]

quote: You can go anywhere you want if you look serious and carry a clipboard.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: You can make it illegal, but you can't make it unpopular.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: You can move the world with an idea, but you have to think of it first.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: You can never do just one thing.
author: Hardin

quote: You can't break eggs without making an omelet.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: You can't judge a book by the way it wears its hair.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: You cannot see the wood for the trees.
author: John Heywood

quote: You get what you pay for.
author: Gabriel Biel

quote: You k'n hide de fier, but w'at you gwine do wid de smoke?
author: Joel Chandler Harris, proverbs of Uncle Remus

quote:
Zhizn' prozhit'--ne pole pereiti.
	[Life's a bitch.]
	[Well, okay.  lit., to live through life is not as simple as crossing
	 a field.  Happy now?]
author: Russian proverb

quote: \MOKE DAT YIGARETTE\""
author: \The Last Coin\", James P. Blaylock"

quote:
You may be marching to the beat of a different drummer, but you're
still in the parade.
author: Unknown (/usr/share/games/fortunes/platitudes)

quote: \World conquerors sometimes become fools, but fools never become world
conquerors.\""
author: \The Outer Limits: The Invisibles\""
